alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Northampton; Suffolk; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 1:17PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Northampton, and central Isle of Wight Counties, the City of Norfolk, the City of Chesapeake, the City of Portsmouth, the southeastern City of Suffolk, the western City of Virginia Beach, the City of Hampton and the southern City of Newport News through 200 PM EDT... At 116 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cape Charles to Grand View to near Holland. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Rain 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Possible flooding of low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Newport News, Hampton, Cape Charles, Ocean View, Kempsville, Virginia Wesleyan University, Hampton University, Old Dominion University, Downtown Norfolk, Regent University, Great Bridge, Downtown Suffolk, Deep Creek, Downtown Portsmouth, Churchland, Norfolk State University, Holland, Norfolk and Chesapeake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Northampton; Suffolk; Virginia Beach
